explanation: The correct answer \( x > 9 \) strictly excludes the value \( 9 \). The student selected \( x \geq 9 \), which includes \( 9 \). Their error stems from incorrectly incorporating the equality condition into the inequality. The phrase "greater than" does not permit equality, but the student treated the threshold value \( 9 \) as part of the solution set. This directly aligns with a failure to distinguish when a strict inequality excludes the boundary value. The related misconception about misunderstanding "less than" notation does not apply here, as the error specifically involves over-inclusion of the threshold in a "greater than" context rather than a directional confusion.
